docs.lead_paragraph: Oklahoma, soon to be followed by Louisiana, has joined other socially conservative states in adopting laws that place new restrictions on abortions, measures that critics say are aimed at shutting abortion clinics.

headline.main: Oklahoma Enacts New Restrictions on Abortions, Louisiana to Follow
headline.print_headline: Oklahoma Enacts New Restrictions on Abortions, Louisiana to Follow

docs.snippet: Oklahoma, soon to be followed by Louisiana, has joined other socially conservative states in adopting laws that place new restrictions on abortions, measures that critics say are aimed at shutting abortion clinics.

docs.lead_paragraph: From Texas to Alabama, laws are being enacted that would greatly restrict access to abortion, forcing many women to travel hundreds of miles to find a clinic. The laws, requiring abortion doctors to have privileges to admit patients to local hospitals, could have a profound impact on women in poor and rural sections of the Bible Belt.

headline.main: Abortion Doctors Restrictions Take Root in South
headline.print_headline: Abortion Doctors Restrictions Take Root in South

docs.lead_paragraph: Maya Angelou, a modern Renaissance woman who survived the harshest of childhoods to become a force on stage, screen, the printed page and the inaugural dais, died Wednesday, her son said. She was 86.

headline.main: Poet, Author Maya Angelou Dies at 86
headline.print_headline: Poet, Author Maya Angelou Dies at 86

docs.snippet: Maya Angelou, a modern Renaissance woman who survived the harshest of childhoods to become a force on stage, screen, the printed page and the inaugural dais, died Wednesday, her son said. She was 86.

docs.lead_paragraph: Maya Angelou's story awed millions. A childhood victim of rape, she broke through silence and shame to tell her tale in one of the most widely read memoirs of the 20th century. A black woman born into poverty and segregation, she recited the most popular presidential inaugural poem in history.

headline.main: Maya Angelou, Celebrated Poet and Author, Dies
headline.print_headline: Maya Angelou, Celebrated Poet and Author, Dies

docs.lead_paragraph: A 46-year-old Orlando woman has become the oldest mother in the United States, and possibly in the world, to give birth to a healthy baby through in-vitro fertilization using her own fresh eggs.

headline.main: Florida Woman, 46, Sets Record for Birth via In-Vitro Fertilization
headline.print_headline: Florida Woman, 46, Sets Record for Birth via In-Vitro Fertilization

docs.snippet: A 46-year-old Orlando woman has become the oldest mother in the United States, and possibly in the world, to give birth to a healthy baby through in-vitro fertilization using her own fresh eggs.

docs.lead_paragraph: Abortion providers tried to persuade a federal judge Tuesday to strike down a Wisconsin law that requires them to have hospital admitting privileges, arguing the mandate is unnecessary, creates nearly insurmountable bureaucratic hurdles and could lead to risky delays for women seeking the procedures.

headline.main: Wisconsin Abortion Clinics: Admitting Law Unneeded
headline.print_headline: Wisconsin Abortion Clinics: Admitting Law Unneeded

docs.lead_paragraph: The corner Safeway is long gone, closed after looting following Martin Luther King Jr.'s assassination in 1968. Some residents have no choice but to buy groceries from an old ice-cream truck. Others rely on men known as "riders" who transport shoppers for a few bucks.

headline.main: Tackling Poverty: DC Community Tries New Approach
headline.print_headline: Tackling Poverty: DC Community Tries New Approach

docs.lead_paragraph: As North Dakota's ban on gay marriage awaits an almost inevitable legal challenge, leaders in the conservative state must decide whether to spend some of its vast oil riches on a court fight — a step they already took to defend another divisive social policy.

headline.main: Gay Marriage Battle Could Head to North Dakota
headline.print_headline: Gay Marriage Battle Could Head to North Dakota

docs.lead_paragraph: A Samoan woman who acknowledged killing her newborn son at a Washington convent where she was studying to become a nun was sentenced Friday to four years in prison.

headline.main: Woman Who Killed Baby at DC Convent Gets 4 Years
headline.print_headline: Woman Who Killed Baby at DC Convent Gets 4 Years

docs.snippet: A Samoan woman who acknowledged killing her newborn son at a Washington convent where she was studying to become a nun was sentenced Friday to four years in prison.
